content.question: The first derivative of the function <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="h prime of x, equals, x to the fourth power, minus x cubed, plus x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. On which of the following intervals is the graph of <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> concave down?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 0.755 comma 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.755</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, 0 comma 0.5, close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>0.5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> only

<math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 0.455 comma infinity, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.455</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>∞</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, negative infinity comma negative 0.455, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.455</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, negative infinity comma negative 0.455, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.455</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
